subject: Re: Recordings
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Jules, I wondered if as you work with the PDs and achieve positive 
results, could they tip you sooner, like as soon as they get a call 
of someone missing...  This way you might receive some clues with 
respect to the whereabouts possibly before things escalate.  I meant 
before in the sense of "before the abductor completes his/her 
intentions."  I could see where this could be very rewarding work for 
you...and yes, frustrating, upsetting, too.  Nice idea, nice work, 
and nice post, Juli.  ;)

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> 
wrote:
>
> its not before LC, unfornately it is after they have gone missing 
or there is a wrongful death attached to their autospy report.  We 
have been able to get names of people who were named by the box and 
backed by police accounts.  This has allowed them to take a another 
look at the statements and requestion those to involved.  It's very 
little but, but has provided additional lines of questioning for 
authorities to pursue.
>    
>   Juli
> 
> LC Duplatt <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>           Wow, Juli! I never thought of boxes being used this way, 
especially 
> to try and find missing and abducted children/people, etc, BEFORE 
> they are harmed. What a great idea to discreetly work with law 
> enforcement behind the scenes to see if it is viable. ;)
> 
> LC
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > Mike,
> > I am an advocate for missing children. I actually 
> have been testing all of the boxes out regarding this, backed up 
with 
> factual data. I can tell you the results are amazing. 
> > 
> > I would be more than happy to speak with you regarding 
> this off the board and share some of my clips if your interested.
> > 
> > I will tell you, that the box will never be able to be 
> used to prove a death or land a conviction, just like you can not 
> have a psychic testify in a court of law. However, if something 
> concrete is received in a message or response, and does in fact 
> coincide with the coroner's inquest, autopsy reports and/or police 
> reports I have in the past, noted the audio and documented it. If 
it 
> could at lease point us in a direction where creditable evidence 
> could be gathered that could solve the case, or lead investigators 
> down the right path to bring the remains of the missing home, then 
> this could be a amazing thing.
> > 
> > Right now as it stands, it is being look at as an 
> additional resource from a psychics perspective and noted just the 
> same. Box communication for this purpose is so new, and most of 
time 
> if you do not have access to the formal reports to back up the 
> responses, then you can not verify the messages from the other side 
> nor can you actually trust that the information you are receiving 
is 
> truth.
> > 
> > This is a very sensitive subject, and you would never 
> want to mislead the families as well as law enforcement on a wild 
> goose chase building up hope in the eyes of families who are will 
do 
> just about anything to find answers and bring closure to grieve.
> > 
> > I only work with law enforcement in what I do, and 
> very rarely do I ever work with the family. If I have information 
> regarding a case, I will submit it to the authorities and only then 
> if something I provide strikes a cord to a case, it is up to them 
to 
> contact me for further information.
> > 
> > I hope this answers some of your questions, for it 
> seems we all have a common goal of utilizing our communication for 
> the greater good.
> > 
> > Juli
> >

> >

> >

> the police in solving a crime.
